summary: Build a cozy, deeply romantic, interactive Rose Day gift website for the user’s boyfriend using responsive HTML/CSS/JavaScript (no heavy frameworks), featuring smooth animations, floating rose petals, hover/click interactions, background music toggle, personalized content sections, and a bouquet/virtual rose gift flow.
architectural_notes: Tech stack: HTML, CSS, JavaScript only; avoid heavy frameworks.
Must be responsive for mobile and desktop.
Design target: single-person audience (boyfriend); prioritize intimate, personal tone.
Animations should be smooth and lightweight/performance-friendly.
known_issues: Bouquet image asset is not loading/displaying (bouquet picture not showing).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive single-page romantic experience with 5 distinct sections in this order: (1) Landing with romantic hero message + rose animation, (2) “Why you are my favorite person”, (3) Virtual rose gift (bouquet) interaction, (4) Love note / message section, (5) Ending screen that reads exactly “Happy Rose Day ❤️”.

Apply a cohesive romantic UI theme consistent across all sections using the specified palette (rose red, soft pink, cream, warm beige), gentle gradients, soft shadows, and an elegant-but-cute, intimate visual style. Use a romantic serif for headings and a clean soft sans-serif for body text (loaded via web fonts).

Implement smooth, lightweight animations: smooth scrolling between sections, subtle section reveal-on-scroll transitions, and romantic micro-interactions (heartbeat/glow) on hover for key interactive elements.

Add a floating rose petals overlay animation that is performant and does not interfere with reading or clicking content (petals should not block pointer events). Provide a user control to reduce motion (respect prefers-reduced-motion).
Implement “hover reveals hidden messages” interactions: certain romantic lines/words should be visually hinted and reveal a hidden message on hover/focus (and tap on mobile) with a gentle transition.

Create a Virtual Rose Gift / bouquet interaction: display a bouquet of roses where individual roses are clickable/tappable; clicking a rose reveals a short love note (modal, popover, or expanding card) with smooth animation.

Add a soft background music toggle (play/pause) that is user-initiated (no autoplay) and clearly indicates state. The toggle must work on mobile and desktop and should not block the rest of the experience if audio cannot play.

Provide personalized romantic copy in English for each section and for micro-interactions (e.g., tooltip/hidden lines, rose-note content). The copy must feel intimate, warm, elegant, and aimed at one person (the boyfriend).

Deliver the complete implementation in the existing React+TypeScript app using Tailwind for styling and lightweight DOM/CSS/Canvas/SVG animations (no additional heavy frameworks). Ensure the experience is fully responsive and touch-friendly.

Fix the bouquet illustration in the Virtual Rose Gift section so it reliably loads and displays in production deployments (including when the app is hosted under a non-root base path). Update the image `src` construction to use the app base URL (instead of a hard-coded leading `/` path), and add a graceful fallback if the image fails to load.
